snippet: As revenue from downloads and CDs decline, subscription services like Spotify and Deezer have become a major driver of digital growth, according to an annual trade industry report.
abstract: Annual industry report finds global market for recorded music fell by 0.4 percent in 2014, to $14.97 billion; year marks first in which sales of online music surpassed those of CDs and other physical formats, though only slightly.
lead_paragraph: As revenue from downloads and CDs decline, subscription services like Spotify and Deezer have become a major driver of digital growth, according to an annual trade industry report.

headline.main: Global Online Music Sales Slightly Surpass CDs and LPs
headline.print_headline: Online Music Sales Eclipse CDs and LPs for the First Time

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Federation of the Phonographic Industry
